Brief Hospital Course:
66 year-old woman with history of asthma, COPD, DM,
hypothyroidism presenting to OSH with acute on chronic dyspnea,
treated with antibiotics for pneumonia and intubated for
worsening hypoxia, and transferred for further management.

# Respiratory failure/pneumonia: She was intubated for worsening
hypoxia on [**2111-6-7**] at the OSH in the setting of pneumonia and
worsening bilateral infiltrates.  Her course was notable for
progressive worsening of her respiratory status during her OSH
hospitalization, along with development of bilateral
infiltrates.  At the time of transfer, her CXR, large A-a
gradient, and low PaO2/FiO2 were thought to be consistent with
ARDS/acute lung injury, and mechanical ventilation settings
targeted low tidal volumes and high respiratory rate.  However,
despite this, her lung was compliant, with low peak inspiratory
pressures.  She was also very PEEP dependent.  Culture data from
the OSH eventually demonstrated MRSA in her sputum culture and
she was initially managed with vancomycin/zosyn and then zosyn
was discontinued, and she was given a course of solumedrol
because of her history of question COPD.  A respiratory viral
screen performed at the OSH was negative and was repeated at
[**Hospital1 18**]. The initial DFA test was negative but the sample was sent
to the state lab and there, it was positive for H1N1.  The ID
service was consulted and recommended switching from vancomycin
to linezolid and empirically completing a course of oseltamavir
Of note, she also underwent a repeat chest CTA that was negative
for PE and a TTE with a bubble study that was limited in quality
but negative for intracardiac shunt. She continued to require
high PEEP with hypoxia if PEEP was lower than 10. Diuresis was
tried several times with minimal change in PEEP. Linezolid was
switched back to vancomycin given concern for lactic acidosis.
ID then recommended switching to meropenem to cover resistent
pseudomonal VAP which she continued for a 15 day course. A PICC
line was placed on [**2111-6-25**] for long term antibiotics.
Oseltamivir was discontinued on [**6-25**]. Vanco was discontinued.
Gradually able to wean down PEEP with improvement in
bronchospastic episodes on increased sedation, and a trach was
placed by IP on [**2111-6-30**]. Sedatives eventually weaned off on [**7-2**]
and transitioned to fentanyl gtt and valium, which too were
weaned off to a 25 mcg patch q72 hours - This should be weaned
further at her facility under the direction of the accepting MD.
Patient was transitioned to lasix IV boluses until Cr and BUN
bumped, then PRN to keep her I/Os even. Although sputum cx with
persistence of pseudomonas, per ID this was thought to represent
colonization. Pt finished her 15 day course of meropenem on
[**2111-7-7**].
- Single lumen PICC was placed [**2111-7-6**] after a 3 day line
holiday.

# Afib with RVR: Patient developed AF with RVR and hypotension.
CHADS score=2. No evidence of PE on CTA chest or right heart
strain on echo; normal atria. She was started on hep gtt and
amio-loaded. She remained in sinus rhythm for the majority of
the rest of her stay aside from one further bout of Afib.
Heparin was discontinued at time of trach placement; long-term
anticoagulation was not started as she is considered low-risk
s/p conversion. She was continued on amiodarone and ASA.

# Volume overload: The patient was volume overloaded after about
1 week in the ICU. Lasix gtt was started to have a smoother
diuresis as bolus doses (of 40mg IV lasix) made her transiently
hypotensive. She was restarted on lasix gtt in setting of
pressors, which were eventually weaned off. She was then
transitioned to IV lasix boluses at 160mg IV tid until Cr and
BUN bumped, then transitioned to PRN Lasix boluses to keep I/Os
even. Of note, she was on acetazolamide for a few days due to
metabolic alkosis but this was discontinued as bicarb
normalizing.
- Please give IV lasix 80-160mg PRN to keep fluid balance even.

# Fungemia: Patient began to spike fevers almost one month into
her hospitalization. She was started on oral fluconazole on
[**2111-7-2**] due to persistent yeast-positive urine cultures despite
changing out Foley catheters.  RIJ placed [**2111-6-20**] was pulled
[**7-2**]. However, [**7-1**] blood cultures from a-line grew out yeast
(presumptively not C. albicans) on [**7-3**]; her A-line and PICC
were pulled. ID was re-consulted and recommended switching to
micafungin. Ophthalmology was consulted and did not see evidence
of endopthalmitis. TTE was suboptimal but without e/o
endocarditis; ID did not think TEE needed. As blood cx grew C.
paraipsilosis, changed to fluconazole IV to complete 14-day
course of antifungal (last dose [**2111-7-16**]). Repeat blood cultures
including mycolytic cultures showed no growth to date up until
[**2111-7-6**].

# Left arm weakness: Patient was noted to be moving all
extremities except the left upper voluntarily on [**2111-7-4**].
Concern was for emoblic event given AF as well as fungemia. CT
Head was done [**7-4**] which showed no acute process and a TTE was
without vegitations. Pt later observed to be moving all 4
extremities and withdrawing to painful stimuli in L arm so no
further work-up pursued.

# Vaginal Bleeding: She was noted to have vaginal bleeding after
a week in the hospital. She was evaluated by OB GYN who could
not find evidence of further bleeding. A pelvic ultrasound was a
very limited study but did not find any pathology. She should
follow up as an outpatient with her OB/Gyn for further workup.

# Hypertriglyceridemia: TG elevated to 303 in setting of
propofol gtt. Pt initially switched to fentanyl and midazolam
with improvement in TG. She was changed back to propofol for
vent weaning with continued improvement and subsequent
normalization of TG prior to discontinuation.

# Atyical BAL pathology: Tissue from bronch done on [**5-31**] showed
atypical plasmacytoid immunoblasts with abnormal CD138+/CD56+
cell population on flow cytometry. Significance unclear in in
the context of an acute viral illness and a reactive process was
favored, although a lymphoproliferative disorder could not be
ruled out. Repeat bronch on [**6-17**] with path read of "lymphocytes,
alveolar macrophages, neutrophils and rare plasma cells with
insufficient tissue for immunohistochemical characterization";
cytology negative for malignant cells.

# Diabetes: Required insulin drip temporarily for elevated blood
glucose but transitioned back to ISS with glargine with good
control.

# Hypothyroidism: Continued levothyroxine.

management of COPD exacerbation and pneumonia requiring
intubation. You likely had swine flu which was complicated by
MRSA pneumonia. You later also developed a Pseudomonas

   I saw and examined the patient, and was physically present with the ICU
   team for the key portions of the services provided. I agree with Dr
   [**Last Name (STitle) 4097**]
s note above, including the assessment and plan. I would
   emphasize and add the following points:
   Mrs. [**Known lastname 6228**] is transferred from [**First Name8 (NamePattern2) 13**] [**Last Name (NamePattern1) **] Hospital where she
   presented with increasing respiratory distress requiring intubation on
   [**2111-6-7**]. She has a h/o COPD/ asthma and had recently completed a few
   courses of antibiotics with steroids. She has needed escalating PEEP
   and FiO2 over the past 24 hrs with a CXR showing worsening bilateral
   ASD. She has remained hemodynamically stable so far. She was
   transferred on Vanco/ Zosyn/ Levaquin and solumedrol ( 60 mg Q8). By
   report viral screen was negative for influenza. She has a PICC and A
   line at present.
   Exam notable for obese WF Tm of 97 BP 150/77 HR of 66 RR of 18 ( VT of
   500 cc, PEEP of 16) with sats of 95% on  FiO2 of 90%. She has scant
   wheezing but features of egophony on both sides. She has no edema.
   Labs notable for WBC of 10 K, HCT of 29.9 , K+ 3.9 , Cr  0.9. recent
   sputum cultures pos for MRSA.
   CXR with diffuse bilateral ASD, cardiomegaly, scant effusions. Recent
   PE protocol CT reviewed from OSH. There is no e/o PE and lung fields
   did not reveal such extensive ASD on [**2111-6-8**]
   She has developed ARDS with rapid respiratory decline over past 72 hrs.
   Possible etiologies include a viral illness complicated by MRSA,
   atypical pathogens, fungal pneumonia etc. Her underlying immune status
   is unclear but by report she does not bear HIV risk.
   Agree with plan to use low VT strategy, high PEEP ( esophageal balloon)
   to limit Tpp at end inspiration and exhalation. She will continue on
   broad antibiotics and will benefit from bronch/ BAL in for obtaining
   respiratory secretions ( likely from RLL). We will also obtain repeat
   echo to r/o other sources of shunt if PaO2/ FiO2 ratio remains poor.
   Remainder of plan as outlined above.

   Assessment and Plan
   66 year-old woman with history of asthma, COPD, DM, hypothyroidism
   presenting to OSH with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with
   antibiotics for pneumonia and intubated for worsening hypoxia, now
   transferred for further management.
   # Respiratory failure:  She was intubated for worsening hypoxia on [**6-7**]
   at the OSH in the setting of pneumonia and worsening bilateral
   infiltrates.  Her CXR, large A-a gradient, and low PaO2/FiO2 are
   consistent with ARDS/acute lung injury.  MRSA on sputum sample from OSH
   suggestive of superinfection following a viral pneumonia but
   influenza/viral screen was negative.  She will need continued
   management of ARDS with ventilatory support.  We have been able to wean
   down her FiO2 while keeping PEEP at 20.  Bronched on [**6-10**] with neg gram
   stain.  On high dose solumedrol from [**6-6**] to [**6-10**].  Sputum culture with
   GPC in pairs and clusters.  BAL with atypical cells (plasma-like cells)
   and [**Doctor Last Name **] from pathology ([**Pager number 6316**]) wants to redo BAL.
   - continue vanc/zosyn ([**Date range (1) 6279**]) for 10 day course
   - continue solumedrol 10 day taper
   - f/u culture data
   - ARDS management with target tidal volumes of 5 cc/kg (ideal body
   weight 45 kg) but overbreathing on vent
   - wean PEEP and FiO2 as tolerated
   - consider repeat bronch for BAL
   - CTA chest without PE
   - check dead space ratio: consider esophageal balloon to optimize PEEP
   # COPD:  Unclear how severe patient's COPD is at baseline.  Asthma is
   well-controlled per pulmonary consult note from OSH.  Will continue
   respiratoy failure management as above.
   - respiratory failure management
   - albuterol and ipratropium inhalers
   # Diabetes: Continue ISS, have uptitrated insulin doses
   # Hypothyroidism:  Continue levothyroxine.
   # FEN: IVF prn, replete electrolytes, regular diet
   # Code: presumed full

   mechanics.  Of note, trial of diuresis over weekend was not helpful but
   CXR today looks volume overloaded and fluid balance positive and may be

   ARDS patients who have negative fluid balance.

   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: H1N1 with superinfection with MRSA and
   ARDS physiology with poor output to lasix 40mg IV
   - Lasix drip today for smoother diuresis since transiently hypotensive
   with lasix yesterday
   - diuresis with goal net negative 1-2L as lower mortality with ARDS
   patients who have negative fluid balance.
   - Change linezolid to PO so less volume. Consider change TFs to less
   volume as well.
   - f/u BAL cultures
   - appreciate ID recs: switched to linezolid (10 days- [**6-27**] last dose)
   and started tamiflu (8 days-[**6-23**] last dose).
   - wean PEEP and FiO2 as tolerated
   - taper solumedrol to 50 mg Q24H (day 3 of 50mg)
   - not candidate for trach due to very advanced resp failure
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: New over the last few days for this admission
   but afebrile yesterday with decrease in leukocytosis. BPs stable.
   Possible sources of infection include lung, abdominal, and urine as
   well as lines. Foley changed for yeast in urine cx.
   - PICC kept in as patient afebrile over yesterday and did not look
   infected.
   - F/u pending bcx, BAL cx, stool studies (CDiff neg)
   - continue linezolid and oseltamivir per ID recs
   - Repeat UA now that foley changed to ensure yeast just contaminant.
   # Metabolic alkalosis: Bicarb has been trending up over last few days.
   Unclear etiology. Will monitor.
   # Anemia:  Unclear etiology but has been trending down since admit.
   Phlebotomy v. vaginal bleed but no active bleed visualized on Gyn exam.
   Stools guaiac negative. Fe studies unrevealing.
   - Hct [**Hospital1 **]
   - transfuse if < 21 or hemodynamically unstable
   #. Diabetes: [**First Name8 (NamePattern2) **] [**Last Name (un) **] recs 60glargine QD with 15 regular Q6H and reg
   SS
   #. Vaginal Bleeding: Currently hemodynamically stable.  No history of
   abnormal bleeding from PCP or hormone therapy. Vaginal exam showed
   blood in vault, but later vaginal exam by OB/GYN did not see any
   blood.  Pelvic U/s unrevealing but OB/GYN suggests outpatient workup as
   gyn cancer is unlikely to cause her symptoms.
   - Appreciate Ob/Gyn recs. Monitor; consider repeat transvaginal
   bleeding if recurs. Otherwise, can have outpatient f/u.
   # ?MS: CT not helpful in giving prognostic indicators family was
   looking for. Likely [**2-16**] medications. Will re-evaluate when able to
   titrate down meds.

   Assessment and Plan
   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: H1N1 with MRSA superinfection and ARDS
   physiology. Now likely fluid overloaded after IV fluid boluses
   yesterday and off lasix gtt given lower-running BPs. Easy agitated with
   severe bronchospasms concerning for ptx risk and requiring increasing
   doses of sedations.
   - Wean PEEP and FiO2 as tolerated
   - Increase sedation (propofol, fentanyl) prn
   - F/u cx
   - Diurese with lasix 20mg x 1 and lasix gtt with pressors as needed.
   Goal net negative 1-2L as lower mortality with ARDS patients who have
   negative fluid balance.
   - If diuresis not helpful, consider other etiologies including PCP
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: New over the last few days for this admission
   but afebrile yesterday with decrease in leukocytosis. BPs stable.
   Possible sources of infection include lung, abdominal, and urine as
   well as lines. Foley changed for yeast in urine cx.
   - Lines changed [**2111-6-20**]
   - F/u pending bcx, BAL cx, stool studies (CDiff neg)
   - continue linezolid, oseltamivir as above per ID recs
   - Ucx pending
   - F/u IR recs
   # Metabolic alkalosis: Bicarb has been trending up over last few days.
   Unclear etiology. Will monitor.
   # Anemia:  Unclear etiology but has been trending down since admit.
   Phlebotomy v. vaginal bleed but no active bleed visualized on Gyn exam.
   Stools guaiac negative. Fe studies unrevealing.
   - transfuse 1 U with post-transfusion hct.
   - transfuse if < 23 or hemodynamically unstable
   #. Diabetes: few low FSG overnight. Adjust scale pen.
   #. MS: Likely [**2-16**] meds. Head CT unhelpful for prognosis. Will see how
   she is on propofol.

   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 2**])
   Assessment:
   Pt. has not been  weaned from vent settings today. Had planned on
   decreasing FiO2 this afternoon as she was stable all morning but she
   had an episode of desaturation with activity this afternoon. She was
   turned, repositioned with bed bath required and she did not tolerate
   length of activity. She desated with a rapid resp rate and gradual drop
   in SBP. She received suctioning for scant secretions, 100% O2 briefly,
   explanation of care as she was also biting on tube and oral airway was
   replaced. She was settled back down in an hour, with adequate sats and
   resp rate in the teens. She does breath over set rate of 16, by [**2-18**]
   breaths. Midaz and fentanyl drips have been slightly weaned today, 5mg
   and 75 mcg an hour. She remains adequately sedated. She has not had
   much secretions via ETT all shift, scant amts of thick, tan secretions.
   Breath sounds throughout are clear. See abg trend in metavision,
   improved O2 over shift. Occ has lrg amts of oral secretions. Mouth care
   per VAP protocol.
   Action:
   Pulm hygiene per MICU plan. Cont antibiotics as ordered. Monitor sats
   closely. Wean PEEP as possible.
   Response:
   Stable abg
s this shift. Scant secretions continue with clear breath
   sounds.
   Plan:
   Cont. vigorous pulm hygiene and wean peep as possible. Maintain O2.

s. She received 10units

s, insulin drip presently at 2 units/hr.

s. Insulin dripo on 2 units per hr, may go

   trached, can wean sedation and pressors and she may mobilize fluid

   - Wean neosynephrine as tolerated

    # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: Initially presented with H1N1 with MRSA
   superinfection and ARDS physiology; now on tx for pseudomonas VAP as
   well with persistence of GNB on sputum gram stain sent yestserday.
   Trach placed [**6-30**] and ability to tolerate trach mask trial yesterday
   encouraging.

   propofol today.

   as able
   - Lidocaine to calm bronchospasms
   - Continue meropenem for pseudomonas VAP X 15 days to end on [**2111-7-6**];
   consider adding ? gent or tobra for double coverage based on
   sensitivities.
   - Cont prednisone taper: D3/3 of 10mg po today; wean to 5mg po tomorrow
   - d/c acetazolamide
   - Cont lasix IV 160mg TID with 24h goal net neg U/O without restarting
   pressors. Check PM lytes.
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: Pt with low grade fever yesterday; leukocytosis
   stable for last week at around 13-15. On meropenem for pseudomonal VAP
   but sputum cx still with GNB. Started on fluconazole yesterday for
   multiple ucx positive for yeast. Yeast growing from BCx from [**7-1**] drawn

   - Continue meropenem x 15 days (last dose 6/22) due to pseudomonas in

   Assessment and Plan
   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
    # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: Initially presented with H1N1 with MRSA
   superinfection and ARDS physiology; now on tx for pseudomonas VAP with
   persistence of pseudomonas on sputum cultures which is intermediate
   sensitivity to meropenem.
   - Consider eval by respiratory/thoracics for possible trach cuff leak
   as concern that balloon may have ruptured
   - Cont to wean vent and sedation  as tolerated to maintain O2sat >90
   and PaO2 >60. Stop valium today and [**Month (only) 202**] fentanyl dose. Attempt to wean
   propofol today.
   - trach trials daily as tolerated with increased time off vent each day
   as able
   - Lidocaine to calm bronchospasms
   - Continue meropenem for pseudomonas VAP X 15 days to end on [**2111-7-6**] as
   likely the fevers are from fungemia
   - Consider ct chest and BAL per ID if respiratory status worsens but
   currently improving daily.
   - Cont prednisone taper: D1/3 at 5mg today
   - Cont lasix IV 160mg TID with 24h goal net neg U/O without restarting
   pressors. Check PM lytes daily.
   # Fungemia: Yeast growing from BCx from [**7-1**] drawn from a-line as well
   as from urine on multiple cultures despite foley change.
   - On micafungin (day 1 [**2111-7-3**])
   - On line holiday
   - Consider cls ophtho and TTE in the next few days for candidemia
   # AFib with RVR: CHADS2 score 1. Had been on heparin but was stopped
   about 1 week ago as was felt to be just lone afib. Now that has
   recurred may consider full dose aspirin or heparin->coumadin.
   - Continue to monitor on tele
   - Rate control with beta blocker PRN
   - Start low dose beta blocker or calcium channel blocker for long term
   rate control as pressures allow.

   superinfection and ARDS physiology; now on tx for pseudomonas VAP with
   persistence of pseudomonas on sputum cultures which is intermediate

   - Continue meropenem for pseudomonas VAP X 15 days to end on [**2111-7-6**] as

   - CT chest today
   - BAL per ID if respiratory status worsens but currently improving
   daily.
   - Cont prednisone taper: D1/3 at 5mg today
   - Cont lasix IV 160mg TID with 24h goal net neg U/O without restarting
   pressors. Check PM lytes daily.

   - Start low dose beta blocker for long term rate control as pressures

   Assessment and Plan
   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # L arm flaccid paralysis: Moving other extremities moving randomly,
   but not moving L arm since yesterday.  Was on heparin for a-fib, but
   stopped several days ago due to CHADs of 2. R pupil sluggish.
   - Head CT
    # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: Initially presented with H1N1 with MRSA
   superinfection and ARDS physiology; now on tx for pseudomonas VAP with
   persistence of pseudomonas on sputum cultures which is intermediate
   sensitivity to meropenem.
   - Consider eval by respiratory/thoracics for possible trach cuff leak
   as concern that balloon may have ruptured
   - Cont to wean vent and sedation as tolerated to maintain O2sat >90 and
   PaO2 >60. Stop valium today and [**Month (only) 202**] fentanyl dose. Attempt to wean
   propofol today.
   - trach trials daily as tolerated with increased time off vent each day
   as able
   - Lidocaine to calm bronchospasms
   - Continue meropenem for pseudomonas VAP X 15 days to end on [**2111-7-6**] as
   likely the fevers are from fungemia
   - CT chest today
   - BAL per ID if respiratory status worsens but currently improving
   daily.
   - Cont prednisone taper: D1/3 at 5mg today
   - Cont lasix IV 160mg TID with 24h goal net neg U/O without restarting
   pressors. Check PM lytes daily.
   # Fungemia: Yeast growing from BCx from [**7-1**] drawn from a-line as well
   as from urine on multiple cultures despite foley change.
   - On micafungin (day 1 [**2111-7-3**])
   - On line holiday
   - surveillance mycolytic culture.
   - Consult ophtho
   - TTE in the next few days for candidemia
   # AFib with RVR: CHADS2 score 1. Had been on heparin but was stopped
   about 1 week ago as was felt to be just lone afib. Now that has
   recurred may consider full dose aspirin or heparin->coumadin.
   - Continue to monitor on tele
   - Rate control with beta blocker PRN.
   - Start low dose beta blocker for long term rate control as pressures
   allow.

   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: Initially presented with H1N1 with MRSA

   [**Month (only) 11**] have mild component of fluid overload as 15L net positive over LOS
   (not accounting for insensible losses).

   PaO2 >60.
   - Continue meropenem for pseudomas VAP X 15 days to end on [**2111-7-6**].

   pressors or rise in BUN/Cr

   (neo<1) with 24h goal net neg 1L
   - Start acetozolimide 500mg Q8hr for metabolic alkalosis -> hopefully
   when trached, can wean sedation and pressors and she may mobilize fluid
   better on her own.
   # Shock: BPs improved with change from zosyn to meropenem suggesting
   had resistant pseudomonas. Likely also component from conversion back
   to sinus rhythm.
   - Wean neosynephrine as tolerated
   - Wean sedation as tolerated
   - Cont amiodarone po (200mg daily starting today)
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: Pt afebrile, leukocytosis fluctuating but mostly
   around 15. Likely [**2-16**] pseudomonas VAP on meropenem. C. diff neg x 2.

   - Attempt peripheral IVs and pull CVL today if no longer need as many

   # Lone Afib: [**Month (only) 11**] have been [**2-16**] overdiuresis. CHADS2 score 2.
   - Cont amiodarone po ->today is first dose 200mg daily
   - As only one episode and has not recurred re-assess the need for
   long-term anticoagulation with coumadin. Consider just asa.

   Assessment and Plan
   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: Initially presented with H1N1 with MRSA
   superinfection and ARDS physiology; Now with pseudomonas VAP as well.
   Trach placed [**6-30**].
   - Cont to wean vent and sedation (d/c fentanyl as on patch, start
   valium po, wean down propofol) as tolerated to maintain O2sat >90 and
   PaO2 >60.
   - Lidocaine to calm bronchospasms
   - Continue meropenem for pseudomas VAP X 15 days to end on [**2111-7-6**].
   - Cont prednisone taper: D2/3 of 10mg po today.
   - Transition lasix gtt to bolus doses if maintains U/O; also resume
   acetazolamide. Goal is run net negative hourly with minimal pressor
   requirement (neo<1) with 24h goal net neg
   # Shock: Likely septic as well as cardiogenic from AF now continued
   need for pressors in setting of sedation
   - Wean sedation as tolerated as above
   - Wean neosynephrine as tolerated
   - Cont amiodarone po
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: Pt with low grade fever last pm, leukocytosis
   stable for last week at around 14-15. On meropenem for pseudomonal VAP.
   - Lactate negative
   - UA with sm leukesterase. Would change foley, start fluconazole today
   given multiple positive ucx with yeast.
   - Continue meropenem x 15 days (last dose 6/22) due to pseudomonas in
   sputum
   - F/u cultures and send C-diff
   - Attempt peripheral IVs and pull [**Date Range 864**] today if no longer need as many
   ports
   # Metabolic alkalosis
   - Resume acetazolamide
   # EKG changes c/w strain: Cardiac enzymes flat. If she had an event it
   was many days ago as trops neg now.
   - Cte ASA (change to NG)
   - Unable to tolerate beta blocker or ACE given borderline BPs
   - [**Month (only) 11**] need o/p workup for CAD when more stable
   ICU Care

   CXR with BLL ASD R>L, stable.

   (not accounting for insensible losses).
   - Plan for trach placement today as at PEEP goal of 10 and FiO2 goal of
   50% - will touch base with IP. Cont to wean vent as tolerated to

   - Wean sedation (Propofol and fentanyl gtt) as tolerated.
   - Continue meropenem for pseudomas VAP X 15 days.
   - F/u ID recs and pending cx.
   - Cont prednisone taper: D [**1-17**] of 15mg po
   - Cont low dose diuresis gtt today as long as no increased need for
   pressors or rise in BUN/Cr on pm lytes
   # Shock: BPs improved with change from zosyn to meropenem suggesting
   had resistant pseudomonas. Likely also component from conversion back
   to sinus rhythm.
   - Wean neosynephrine as tolerated
   - Cont amiodarone po
   - Continue sedation at current doses for trach today.
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: Pseudomonas VAP now on meropenem with bump in
   WBC yesterday. 1 of 2 sets ?peripheral bcx from [**6-20**] growing GPC in
   clusters while pt on linezolid but had been switched back to vanc on
   [**6-22**] due to concern for lactic acidosis; possible this may have been
   contaminant. C. diff neg x 2. CXR without change. WBC improved today
   with no change in antibiotic coverage.
   - Lines changed [**2111-6-20**]
   - Send surveillance cx
   - Continue vanc for now pending speciation of bcx
   - Continue meropenem D [**4-29**] (last dose 6/22) due to pseudomonas in
   sputum
   - Oseltamivir discontinued [**6-25**]
   # Afib: [**Month (only) 11**] be [**2-16**] overdiuresis. No e/o PE. TSH WNL. In sinus now s/p
   pharm conversion.
   - Cont amoi po (currently 200mg po BID x 7 days) for at least a few
   months
   - Cte hep gtt and hold on coumadin (CHADS2 score = 2) given need for
   trach/peg in next few days
   # Metabolic Alkalosis: Unclear etiology but did improve with
   acetazolamide earlier. Bicarb slightly higher today, may be in setting
   of diuresis although no bump in BUN/Cr
   - Recheck PM lytes; d/c lasix gtt as indicated

   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: Initially presented with H1N1 with MRSA
   superinfection and ARDS physiology; Now with pseudomonas VAP as well.
   [**Month (only) 11**] have mild component of fluid overload as 15L net positive over LOS
   (not accounting for insensible losses).
   - Plan for trach placement today as at PEEP goal of 10 and FiO2 goal of
   50% - will touch base with IP. Cont to wean vent as tolerated to
   maintain O2sat >90 and PaO2 >60. Check ABG on current vent settings
   (55% fio2)
   - Wean sedation (Propofol and fentanyl gtt) as tolerated.
   - Continue meropenem for pseudomas VAP X 15 days.
   - F/u ID recs and pending cx.
   - Cont prednisone taper: D [**1-17**] of 15mg po
   - Cont low dose diuresis gtt today as long as no increased need for
   pressors or rise in BUN/Cr on pm lytes
   - Goal is run net negative hourly with minimal pressor requirement
   (neo<1)
   # Shock: BPs improved with change from zosyn to meropenem suggesting
   had resistant pseudomonas. Likely also component from conversion back
   to sinus rhythm.
   - Wean neosynephrine as tolerated
   - Cont amiodarone po
   - Continue sedation at current doses.
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: Pseudomonas VAP now on meropenem with bump in
   WBC yesterday. 1 of 2 sets ?peripheral bcx from [**6-20**] growing GPC in
   clusters while pt on linezolid but had been switched back to vanc on
   [**6-22**] due to concern for lactic acidosis; possible this may have been
   contaminant. C. diff neg x 2. CXR without change. WBC improved today
   with no change in antibiotic coverage.
   - Lines changed [**2111-6-20**]
   - Send surveillance cx
   - Continue vanc for now pending speciation of bcx
   - Continue meropenem D [**5-29**] (last dose 6/22) due to pseudomonas in
   sputum
   - Oseltamivir discontinued [**6-25**]
   # Afib: [**Month (only) 11**] be [**2-16**] overdiuresis. No e/o PE. TSH WNL. In sinus now s/p
   pharm conversion.
   - Cont amoi po (currently 200mg po BID x 7 days) for at least a few
   months
   - Cte hep gtt until trach placement.
   - hold on coumadin (CHADS2 score = 2) given need for trach/peg in next
   few days
   # Metabolic Alkalosis: Unclear etiology but did improve with
   acetazolamide earlier. Bicarb slightly higher today, may be in setting
   of diuresis although no bump in BUN/Cr
   - Recheck PM lytes; d/c lasix gtt as indicated
   # Anemia:  Had downtrended since admit w/ question of phlebotomy v.
   vaginal bleed. No active bleed visualized on exam by OB/GYN. Stools
   guaiac negative. Fe studies unrevealing. Now trending down again.
   - Repeat PM Hct
   - Guaiac stools
   - Transfuse if <21 or hemodynamically unstable
   - Send T+C

   Assessment and Plan
   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: Initially presented with H1N1 with MRSA
   superinfection and ARDS physiology; Now with pseudomonas VAP as well.
   [**Month (only) 11**] have mild component of fluid overload as 15L net positive over LOS
   (not accounting for insensible losses).
   - Plan for trach placement on Monday as at PEEP goal of 8 and FiO2 goal
   of 50% - will touch base with IP then. Cont to wean vent as tolerated
   to maintain O2sat >90 and PaO2 >60.
   - Wean sedation (Propofol and fentanyl gtt) as tolerated.
   - Continue meropenem for pseudomas VAP X 15 days to end on [**2111-7-6**].
   - F/u ID recs and pending cx.
   - Cont prednisone taper: D [**3-17**] of 15mg po. Tomorrow will have 10mg PO
   daily.
   - Cont low dose diuresis gtt today as long as no increased need for
   pressors or rise in BUN/Cr on pm lytes
   - Goal is run net negative hourly with minimal pressor requirement
   (neo<1) with 24h goal net neg 1L
   # Shock: BPs improved with change from zosyn to meropenem suggesting
   had resistant pseudomonas. Likely also component from conversion back
   to sinus rhythm.
   - Wean neosynephrine as tolerated
   - Cont amiodarone po
   - Continue sedation at current doses. Check triglycerides as has been
   on propofol several days.
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: Pseudomonas VAP now on meropenem. 1 of 2 sets
   ?peripheral bcx from [**6-20**] growing coag neg staph while pt on linezolid
   but had been switched back to vanc on [**6-22**] due to concern for lactic
   acidosis; possible this may have been contaminant. C. diff neg x 2. CXR
   without change.
   - Lines changed [**2111-6-20**]
   - Surveillance cx NGTD
   - Continue meropenem x15 days (last dose 6/22) due to pseudomonas in
   sputum
   - Oseltamivir discontinued [**6-25**]; Vanc discontinued [**6-26**]
   # Afib: [**Month (only) 11**] be [**2-16**] overdiuresis. No e/o PE. TSH WNL. In sinus now s/p
   pharm conversion.
   - Cont amiodarone po (currently 200mg po BID x 7 days to end [**6-30**]) then
   200mg PO daily
   - Cte hep gtt until trach placement.
   - hold on coumadin (CHADS2 score = 2) given need for trach/peg in next
   few days

   meropenem instead of zosyn.
   - Lines changed [**2111-6-20**]

   # Afib: [**Month (only) 11**] be [**2-16**] overdiuresis. No e/o PE. TSH WNL. In sinus now s/p

   Assessment and Plan
   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Shock: BPs have improved with change from zosyn to meropenem
   suggesting had resistant pseudomonas making septic shock more likely
   - Switched from levophed to neosynephrine
   - Cont amiodarone, transition to po
   - Cte prednisone taper starting at 20mg po
   - Decrease PEEP as tolerated, follow ABGs and wean as long as Sats in
   the 90s and PaO2 in 60-70s.
   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: Initially presented with H1N1 with MRSA
   superinfection and ARDS physiology; Now with pseudomonas VAP as well
   - Cls IP re: trach in the next day or two as will likely not be able to
   come off ventilator soon and been on vent X 15days
   - wean off PEEP using increased sedation (try titrating fentanyl) and
   FiO2 as tolerated
   - Increase sedation (propofol, fentanyl) prn to combat coughing spells.
   - continue vanc and meropenem for VAP
   - f/u pending cx
   - f/u ID recs
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: likely pseudomonas VAP. Now improving on
   meropenem instead of zosyn.
   - Lines changed [**2111-6-20**]
   - F/u pending sputum cx, bcx, BAL cx, stool studies (CDiff neg)
   - Continue Vanco and meropenem as above, oseltamivir x 10 d (last dose
   [**6-26**])
   # Afib: [**Month (only) 11**] be [**2-16**] overdiuresis. No e/o PE. TSH WNL. In sinus now s/p
   pharm conversion.
   - Cont amoi po (currently 200mg po BID) for at least a few months
   - Cte hep gtt and hold on coumadin (CHADS2 score = 2) given need for
   trach/peg in next few days
   # Metaboic Alkalosis: Unclear etiology. Acetazolamide did help.
   - Cte acetazolamide and monitor bicarb
   # Anemia:  Unclear etiology but has been trending down since admit.
   Possibly due to phlebotomy v. vaginal bleed but no active bleed
   visualized on exam by OB/GYN. Stools guaiac negative. Fe studies
   unrevealing.
   - transfuse if < 23 or hemodynamically unstable
   #. Diabetes: Cont insulin gtt for now as critically ill and titrating
   steroids; will transition to insulin SC when more stable
   #. MS: Likely [**2-16**] meds. Head CT unhelpful for prognosis. Reassess as
   able to wean sedation.

   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Shock: BPs improved with change from zosyn to meropenem suggesting
   had resistant pseudomonas. Likely also with improvement from conversion
   back to sinus rhythm
   - Wean neosynephrine as tolerated
   - Cont amiodarone po
   - Cont prednisone taper: D [**3-17**] of 20mg po, decrease to 15mgpo  tomorrow
   - Defer diuresis as of now.
   - continue sedation at current doses for trach today.
   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: Initially presented with H1N1 with MRSA
   superinfection and ARDS physiology; Now with pseudomonas VAP as well
   - Plan for trach placement Friday as at PEEP goal of 10 and FiO2 goal
   of 50%; cont to wean as tolerated to maintain O2sat >90 and PaO2 >60
   - Wean sedation (Propofol and fentanyl gtt) as tolerated
   - Continue meropenem for pseudomas VAP, vanco for MRSA pneumonia
   - f/u pending cx
   - f/u ID recs
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: Pseudomonas VAP now on meropenem.
   - Lines changed [**2111-6-20**]
   - F/u pending sputum cx, bcx, BAL cx, stool studies (CDiff neg)
   - Meropenem D3/8 (last dose 6/16)
   - Oseltamivir discontinued yesterday
   ID recommended 8 day course of meropenem and also to d/c vanc, but we
   would like to [**Doctor Last Name **] down her Abx regimen step wise, starting with
   oseltamivir.
   # Afib: [**Month (only) 11**] be [**2-16**] overdiuresis. No e/o PE. TSH WNL. In sinus now s/p
   pharm conversion.
   - Cont amoi po (currently 200mg po BID x 7 days) for at least a few
   months
   - Cte hep gtt and hold on coumadin (CHADS2 score = 2) given need for
   trach/peg in next few days
   # Metaboic Alkalosis: Unclear etiology. Acetazolamide did help.
   - Cte acetazolamide and monitor bicarb
   # Anemia:  Unclear etiology but has been trending down since admit.
   Possibly due to phlebotomy v. vaginal bleed but no active bleed
   visualized on exam by OB/GYN. Stools guaiac negative. Fe studies
   unrevealing.
   - transfuse if < 23 or hemodynamically unstable
   #. Diabetes: Cont insulin gtt for now as critically ill and titrating
   steroids
   - transition to insulin SC today
   #. MS: Likely [**2-16**] meds. Head CT unhelpful for prognosis. Reassess as
   able to wean sedation.

   - Goal is run net negative hourly with minimal pressor requirement
   (neo<1) with 24h goal net neg 1L
   # Shock: BPs improved with change from zosyn to meropenem suggesting

   Assessment and Plan
   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: H1N1 with superinfection with MRSA and
   ARDS physiology. Still net positive on lasix gtt; dose limited by BP.
   - Diuresis with goal net negative 1-2L as lower mortality with ARDS
   patients who have negative fluid balance. Restart lasix gtt as
   tolerated and review I/O to minimize IV fluids in
   - f/u BAL cultures
   - appreciate ID recs: switched to linezolid (10 days- [**6-27**] last dose)
   and started tamiflu (8 days-[**6-23**] last dose).
   - wean PEEP and FiO2 as tolerated
   - taper solumedrol by 10mg q3d, decrease to 40 mg Q24H today
   - not candidate for trach due to very advanced resp failure
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: New over the last few days for this admission
   but afebrile yesterday with decrease in leukocytosis. BPs stable.
   Possible sources of infection include lung, abdominal, and urine as
   well as lines. Foley changed for yeast in urine cx.
   - PICC kept in as patient afebrile over yesterday and did not look
   infected.
   - F/u pending bcx, BAL cx, stool studies (CDiff neg)
   - continue linezolid and oseltamivir as above per ID recs
   - Repeat UA now that foley changed to ensure yeast just contaminant.
   # Metabolic alkalosis: Bicarb has been trending up over last few days.
   Unclear etiology. Will monitor.
   # Anemia:  Unclear etiology but has been trending down since admit.
   Phlebotomy v. vaginal bleed but no active bleed visualized on Gyn exam.
   Stools guaiac negative. Fe studies unrevealing.
   - Hct [**Hospital1 **]
   - transfuse if < 21 or hemodynamically unstable
   #. Diabetes: [**First Name8 (NamePattern2) **] [**Last Name (un) **] recs 60glargine QD with 15 regular Q6H and reg
   SS
   #. Vaginal Bleeding: Currently hemodynamically stable.  No history of
   abnormal bleeding from PCP or hormone therapy. Vaginal exam showed
   blood in vault, but later vaginal exam by OB/GYN did not see any
   blood.  Pelvic U/s unrevealing but OB/GYN suggests outpatient workup as
   gyn cancer is unlikely to cause her symptoms.
   - Appreciate Ob/Gyn recs. Monitor; consider repeat transvaginal
   bleeding if recurs. Otherwise, can have outpatient f/u.
   # ?MS: CT not helpful in giving prognostic indicators family was
   looking for. Likely [**2-16**] medications. Will re-evaluate when able to
   titrate down meds.

   Assessment and Plan
   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Shock: BPs improved with change from zosyn to meropenem suggesting
   had resistant pseudomonas. Likely also with improvement from conversion
   back to sinus rhythm
   - Wean neosynephrine as tolerated
   - Cont amiodarone po
   - Cont prednisone taper: D [**3-17**] of 20mg po, decrease to 15mgpo  tomorrow
   - Defer diuresis as of now.
   - continue sedation at current doses for trach today.
   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: Initially presented with H1N1 with MRSA
   superinfection and ARDS physiology; Now with pseudomonas VAP as well
   - Plan for trach placement Friday as at PEEP goal of 10 and FiO2 goal
   of 50%; cont to wean as tolerated to maintain O2sat >90 and PaO2 >60
   - Wean sedation (Propofol and fentanyl gtt) as tolerated
   - Continue meropenem for pseudomas VAP X 15days
   - f/u pending cx
   - f/u ID recs
   - Recheck ABG on PEEP 10 and fi02 50%
   - 1L Positive over yesterday. Consider diuresis today if CXR wet.
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: Pseudomonas VAP now on meropenem.
   - Lines changed [**2111-6-20**]
   - F/u pending sputum cx, bcx, BAL cx, stool studies (CDiff neg)
   - Meropenem D3/15 (last dose 6/22) because pseudomonas in sputum
   - Oseltamivir discontinued yesterday
   ID recommended 8 day course of meropenem and also to d/c vanc, but we
   would like to [**Doctor Last Name **] down her Abx regimen step wise, starting with
   oseltamivir. D/C vanc tomorrow if no fevers.
   # Afib: [**Month (only) 11**] be [**2-16**] overdiuresis. No e/o PE. TSH WNL. In sinus now s/p
   pharm conversion.
   - Cont amoi po (currently 200mg po BID x 7 days) for at least a few
   months
   - Cte hep gtt and hold on coumadin (CHADS2 score = 2) given need for
   trach/peg in next few days
   # Metaboic Alkalosis: Unclear etiology. Acetazolamide did help.
   Improving over last few days.
   # Anemia:  Unclear etiology but has been trending down since admit.
   Possibly due to phlebotomy v. vaginal bleed but no active bleed
   visualized on exam by OB/GYN. Stools guaiac negative. Fe studies
   unrevealing.
   - transfuse if < 23 or hemodynamically unstable

   Assessment and Plan
   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Shock: Patient with increasing pressor requirement yesterday in the
   setting of worsened leukocytosis with new CXR infiltrates, new atrial
   Fib, and in setting of discontinued steroids. Possible etiologies
   include cardiogenic, CVL in atrium, sepsis given new pseudomonas+
   sputum cx, adrenal insufficiency, or increasing PEEP requirement. BP
   now improving s/p pharmacological conversion on amiodarone with pressor
   change, pull-back of CVL, change in abx, reinitiation of steroids, and
   decreased PEEP. No evidence of PE.
   - On vanc; zosyn changed to meropenem given pseudomonas with borderline
   sensitivities to zosyn on prelim cx
   - Switched from levophed to neosynephrine
   - Cont amiodarone, transition to po
   - Will d/c hydrocortisone and restart prednisone taper starting at 20mg
   po
   - Decrease PEEP as tolerated, follow ABGs and wean as long as Sats in
   the 90s and PaO2 in 60-70s.
   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: Initially presented with H1N1 with MRSA
   superinfection and ARDS physiology; febrile yesterday to 102 with
   ?worsening RUL and bilateral lower lobe consolidations with sputum +
   for pseudomonas. Agitation and bronchospastic/cough spells have
   resolved since increasing doses of sedations.  Off lasix gtt as thought
   to be dry.
   - wean off PEEP and FiO2 as tolerated as above
   - Increase sedation (propofol, fentanyl) prn to combat coughing spells.
   - continue vanc; change meropenem for VAP as borderline sensitive to
   zosyn
   - f/u pending cx
   - f/u ID recs
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: Febrile yesterday with increased leukocytosis so
   Zosyn was added and linezolid changed to vanco d/t concern for lactic
   acidosis; now has likely pseudomonas VAP. All other cx NGTD with
   exception for yeast in urine, for which foley changed.
   - Lines changed [**2111-6-20**]
   - F/u pending sputum cx, bcx, BAL cx, stool studies (CDiff neg)
   - Continue Vanco and meropenem as above, oseltamivir x 10 d (last dose
   [**6-26**])
   # Afib: [**Month (only) 11**] be [**2-16**] overdiuresis. No e/o PE. TSH pending.
   - F/u TSH
   - Cont amio gtt and transition to po
   - Cont hep gtt for now
   # Anemia:  Unclear etiology but has been trending down since admit.
   Possibly due to phlebotomy v. vaginal bleed but no active bleed
   visualized on exam by OB/GYN. Stools guaiac negative. Fe studies
   unrevealing.
   - transfuse if < 23 or hemodynamically unstable
   #. Diabetes: elevated BG overnight after scheduled regular insulin was
   d/c
   - insulin gtt started
   - will get 1 day of accurate insulin requirements, and transition to
   sub-Q after that
   #. MS: Likely [**2-16**] meds. Head CT unhelpful for prognosis. Reassess as
   able to wean sedation.
   ICU Care

   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure:  Patient intubated for worsening hypoxia
   on [**6-7**] at the OSH in the setting of worsening bilateral infiltrates
   and presumptive dx of pneumonia.  H1N1 negative on screens but positive
   on state cx; MRSA on sputum sample from OSH suggestive of
   superinfection following a viral PNA although CT chest nl. Her CXR,
   large A-a gradient, and low PaO2/FiO2 are consistent with ARDS but not
   mechanics.  Of note, trial of diuresis over weekend was not helpful but
   CXR today looks volume overloaded and fluid balance positive and may be
   cause of continued difficult ventilation.
   - diuresis today with goal net negative 1-2L as lower mortality with
   ARDS patients who have negative fluid balance.
   - Change linezolid to PO so less volume. Consider change TFs to less
   volume as well.
   - f/u BAL cultures
   - appreciate ID recs: switched to linezolid and started tamiflu. - wean
   PEEP and FiO2 as tolerated
   - taper solumedrol to 50 mg Q24H today
   - not candidate for trach due to very advanced resp failure
   .
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: New over the last few days for this admission
   with max today now to 101.1 after d/cing Zosyn [**6-15**]. BPs stable.
   Possible sources of infection include lung, abdominal, and urine as
   well as lines.
   - PICC from OSH. Will need to take out. Resite PIV and if unable will
   likely need CVL.
   - F/u pending bcx, ucx, BAL cx, stool studies
   - Vanco changed to linezolid and started oseltamivir per ID recs
   - Consider adding back zosyn given d/c
d on [**6-15**] and now
   worsening->however white count started rising prior to this on [**6-12**].
   - Consider CT abd if continues to spike
   .
   # Anemia:  Unclear etiology (consider vaginal bleeding), but has been
   trending down since admit. No source identified yet. Stool guaiac
   negative thus far.
   - daily Hct
   - Fe studies unrevealing
   - transfuse if < 21 or hemodynamically unstable
   - vaginal exam
   .
   #. Vaginal Bleeding: Currently hemodynamically stable.  No history of
   abnormal bleeding from PCP or hormone therapy. Vaginal exam showed
   blood in vault, but later vaginal exam by OB/GYN did not see any blood.
   - Pelvic U/S
   - f/u Ob/gyn recs.
   .

   Assessment and Plan
   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: H1N1 with MRSA superinfection and ARDS
   physiology. Now likely fluid overloaded after IV fluid boluses
   yesterday and off lasix gtt given lower-running BPs. Easy agitated with
   severe bronchospasms concerning for ptx risk and requiring increasing
   doses of sedations.
   - Wean PEEP and FiO2 as tolerated
   - Increase sedation (propofol, fentanyl) prn
   - F/u cx
   - Diurese with lasix 20mg x 1 and lasix gtt with pressors as needed.
   Goal net negative 1-2L as lower mortality with ARDS patients who have
   negative fluid balance.
   - If diuresis not helpful, consider other etiologies including PCP
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: New over the last few days for this admission
   but afebrile yesterday with decrease in leukocytosis. BPs stable.
   Possible sources of infection include lung, abdominal, and urine as
   well as lines. Foley changed for yeast in urine cx.
   - Lines changed [**2111-6-20**]
   - F/u pending bcx, BAL cx, stool studies (CDiff neg)
   - continue linezolid, oseltamivir as above per ID recs
   - Ucx pending
   - F/u IR recs
   # Metabolic alkalosis: Bicarb has been trending up over last few days,
   but down to 31 today. Will monitor.
   # Anemia:  Unclear etiology but has been trending down since admit.
   Possibly due to phlebotomy v. vaginal bleed but no active bleed
   visualized on exam by OB/GYN. Stools guaiac negative. Fe studies
   unrevealing.
   - transfuse 1 U for Hct of 19 and get post-transfusion hct.
   - transfuse if < 23 or hemodynamically unstable
   #. Diabetes: few low FSG overnight. Adjust scale pen.
   #. MS: Likely [**2-16**] meds. Head CT unhelpful for prognosis. Will see how
   she is on propofol.

   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: H1N1 with MRSA superinfection and ARDS
   physiology. Now likely fluid overloaded. Agitation and
   bronchospastic/cough spells have resolved since increasing doses of
   sedations.  Lasix gtt started in PM yesterday with decent output, but
   input was +3.5L.
   - Increase lasix gtt for goal of -1to -2 L
   - Wean PEEP and FiO2 as tolerated
   - Increase sedation (propofol, fentanyl) prn
   - F/u cx

   # Fevers/leukocytosis: New over the last few days for this admission.
   Febrile yesterday and increased leukocytosis so Zosyn was added and
   sputum cx sent. Possible sources of infection include lung, abdominal,
   and urine as well as lines. Foley changed for yeast in urine cx.
   - Lines changed [**2111-6-20**]
   - F/u pending bcx, BAL cx, stool studies (CDiff neg)
   - Added Zosyn
   - continue linezolid, oseltamivir as above per ID recs
   - Ucx pending
   # Metabolic alkalosis: Bicarb has been trending up over last few days,
   but down to 31 today. Will monitor.
   # Anemia:  Unclear etiology but has been trending down since admit.
   Possibly due to phlebotomy v. vaginal bleed but no active bleed
   visualized on exam by OB/GYN. Stools guaiac negative. Fe studies
   unrevealing.
   - transfuse 1 U for Hct of 19 and get post-transfusion hct.
   - transfuse if < 23 or hemodynamically unstable
   #. Diabetes: elevated BG overnight after scheduled regular insulin was
   d/c
   - insulin gtt started
   - will get 1 day of accurate insulin requirements, and transition to
   sub-Q after that
   #. MS: Likely [**2-16**] meds. Head CT unhelpful for prognosis. Will see how
   she is on propofol.

   Assessment and Plan
   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: H1N1 with superinfection with MRSA and
   ARDS physiology. Still net positive on lasix gtt; dose limited by BP.
   - Try propofol with fentanyl bolus today and d/c midaz/fentanyl
   - Diuresis with goal net negative 1-2L as lower mortality with ARDS
   patients who have negative fluid balance. Restart lasix gtt as
   tolerated and review I/O to minimize IV fluids in
   - f/u BAL cultures
   - appreciate ID recs: switched to linezolid (10 days- [**6-27**] last dose)
   and started tamiflu (8 days-[**6-23**] last dose).
   - wean PEEP and FiO2 as tolerated
   - taper solumedrol by 10mg q3d, decrease to 40 mg Q24H today
   - not candidate for trach due to very advanced resp failure
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: New over the last few days for this admission
   but afebrile yesterday with decrease in leukocytosis. BPs stable.
   Possible sources of infection include lung, abdominal, and urine as
   well as lines. Foley changed for yeast in urine cx.
   - Check diff on WBC today
   - PICC kept in as patient afebrile over yesterday and did not look
   infected but if bands will d/c picc
   - F/u pending bcx, BAL cx, stool studies (CDiff neg)
   - continue linezolid and oseltamivir as above per ID recs
   - Repeat UA now that foley changed to ensure yeast just contaminant.
   # Metabolic alkalosis: Bicarb has been trending up over last few days.
   Unclear etiology. Will monitor.
   # Anemia:  Unclear etiology but has been trending down since admit.
   Phlebotomy v. vaginal bleed but no active bleed visualized on Gyn exam.
   Stools guaiac negative. Fe studies unrevealing.
   - Hct daily
   - transfuse if < 21 or hemodynamically unstable
   #. Diabetes: [**First Name8 (NamePattern2) **] [**Last Name (un) **] recs 60glargine QD with 15 regular Q6H and reg

   #. MS: Likely [**2-16**] meds. Head CT unhelpful for prognosis. Will see how

   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure:  Patient intubated for worsening hypoxia
   on [**6-7**] at the OSH in the setting of worsening bilateral infiltrates
   and presumptive dx of pneumonia.  H1N1 negative on screens but positive
   on state cx; MRSA on sputum sample from OSH suggestive of
   superinfection following a viral PNA although CT chest nl. Her CXR,
   large A-a gradient, and low PaO2/FiO2 consistent with ARDS but not
   mechanics.  Of note, trial of diuresis over weekend was not helpful but
   CXR today looks volume overloaded and fluid balance positive and may be
   cause of continued difficult ventilation.
   - diuresis with goal net negative 1-2L as lower mortality with ARDS
   patients who have negative fluid balance.
   - Change linezolid to PO so less volume. Consider change TFs to less
   volume as well.
   - f/u BAL cultures
   - appreciate ID recs: switched to linezolid and started tamiflu. - wean
   PEEP and FiO2 as tolerated
   - taper solumedrol to 50 mg Q24H today
   - not candidate for trach due to very advanced resp failure
   .
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: New over the last few days for this admission
   but afebrile yesterday. BPs stable. Possible sources of infection
   include lung, abdominal, and urine as well as lines.
   - PICC kept in as patient afebrile over yesterday.
   - F/u pending bcx, ucx, BAL cx, stool studies
   - continue linezolid and oseltamivir per ID recs
   - Consider adding back zosyn given d/c
d on [**6-15**] and now
   worsening->however white count started rising prior to this on [**6-12**].
   - Consider CT abd if continues to spike
   .
   # Anemia:  Unclear etiology but has been trending down since admit.
   Phlebotomy v. vaginal bleed but no active bleed visualized on Gyn exam.
   Stools guaiac negative. Fe studies unrevealing.
   - daily Hct
   - transfuse if < 21 or hemodynamically unstable
   .
   #. Vaginal Bleeding: Currently hemodynamically stable.  No history of
   abnormal bleeding from PCP or hormone therapy. Vaginal exam showed
   blood in vault, but later vaginal exam by OB/GYN did not see any
   blood.  Pelvic U/s unrevealing but OB/GYN suggests outpatient workup as

   on state cx; MRSA on sputum sample from OSH suggestive of
   superinfection following a viral PNA although CT chest nl. Her CXR,
   large A-a gradient, and low PaO2/FiO2 consistent with ARDS but not
   mechanics.  Of note, trial of diuresis over weekend was not helpful but
   CXR today looks volume overloaded and fluid balance positive and may be
   cause of continued difficult ventilation.
   - diuresis with goal net negative 1-2L as lower mortality with ARDS
   patients who have negative fluid balance.

   Assessment and Plan
   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: H1N1 with superinfection with MRSA and
   ARDS physiology. Still net positive on lasix gtt; dose limited by BP.
   - Try propofol with fentanyl bolus today and d/c midaz/fentanyl
   - Diuresis with goal net negative 1-2L as lower mortality with ARDS
   patients who have negative fluid balance. Restart lasix gtt as
   tolerated and review I/O to minimize IV fluids in
   - f/u BAL cultures
   - appreciate ID recs: switched to linezolid (10 days- [**6-27**] last dose)
   and started tamiflu (8 days-[**6-23**] last dose).
   - wean PEEP and FiO2 as tolerated
   - taper solumedrol by 10mg q3d, decrease to 40 mg Q24H today
   - not candidate for trach due to very advanced resp failure
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: New over the last few days for this admission
   but afebrile yesterday with decrease in leukocytosis. BPs stable.
   Possible sources of infection include lung, abdominal, and urine as
   well as lines. Foley changed for yeast in urine cx.
   - Check diff on WBC today
   - PICC kept in as patient afebrile over yesterday and did not look
   infected but if bands will d/c picc
   - F/u pending bcx, BAL cx, stool studies (CDiff neg)
   - continue linezolid and oseltamivir as above per ID recs
   - Repeat UA now that foley changed to ensure yeast just contaminant.
   # Metabolic alkalosis: Bicarb has been trending up over last few days.
   Unclear etiology. Will monitor.
   # Anemia:  Unclear etiology but has been trending down since admit.
   Phlebotomy v. vaginal bleed but no active bleed visualized on Gyn exam.
   Stools guaiac negative. Fe studies unrevealing.
   - Hct daily
   - transfuse if < 21 or hemodynamically unstable
   #. Diabetes: [**First Name8 (NamePattern2) **] [**Last Name (un) **] recs 60glargine QD with 15 regular Q6H and reg
   SS
   #. MS: Likely [**2-16**] meds. Head CT unhelpful for prognosis. Will see how
   she is on propofol.

   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Hypoxic Respiratory failure:  Patient intubated for worsening hypoxia
   on [**6-7**] at the OSH in the setting of worsening bilateral infiltrates
   and presumptive dx of pneumonia.  H1N1 negative on screens but positive
   on state cx; MRSA on sputum sample from OSH suggestive of
   superinfection following a viral PNA although CT chest nl. Her CXR,
   large A-a gradient, and low PaO2/FiO2 are consistent with ARDS but not
   mechanics.  Of note, trial of diuresis over weekend was not helpful but
   CXR today looks volume overloaded and fluid balance positive and may be
   cause of continued difficult ventilation.
   - diuresis today with goal net negative 1-2L as lower mortality with
   ARDS patients who have negative fluid balance.
   - Change linezolid to PO so less volume. Consider change TFs to less
   volume as well.
   - f/u BAL cultures
   - appreciate ID recs: switched to linezolid and started tamiflu. - wean
   PEEP and FiO2 as tolerated
   - taper solumedrol to 50 mg Q24H today
   - not candidate for trach due to very advanced resp failure
   .
   # Fevers/leukocytosis: New over the last few days for this admission
   but afebrile yesterday. BPs stable. Possible sources of infection
   include lung, abdominal, and urine as well as lines.
   - PICC kept in as patient afebrile over yesterday.
   - F/u pending bcx, ucx, BAL cx, stool studies
   - continue linezolid and oseltamivir per ID recs
   - Consider adding back zosyn given d/c
d on [**6-15**] and now
   worsening->however white count started rising prior to this on [**6-12**].
   - Consider CT abd if continues to spike
   .
   # Anemia:  Unclear etiology (consider vaginal bleeding), but has been
   trending down since admit. No source identified yet. Stool guaiac
   negative thus far.
   - daily Hct
   - Fe studies unrevealing
   - transfuse if < 21 or hemodynamically unstable
   .
   #. Vaginal Bleeding: Currently hemodynamically stable.  No history of
   abnormal bleeding from PCP or hormone therapy. Vaginal exam showed
   blood in vault, but later vaginal exam by OB/GYN did not see any
   blood.  Pelvic U/s unrevealing but OB/GYN suggests outpatient workup as
   gyn cancer is unlikely to cause her symptoms.
   - f/u Ob/gyn recs.
   .
   # Asthma: Patient
s PCP confirmed [**Name9 (PRE) **]
[**Name Initial (PRE) **] more consistent with asthma
   than COPD.  Asthma is well-controlled per pulmonary consult note from
   OSH.  Will continue respiratoy failure management as above.

   superinfection and ARDS physiology; now on tx for pseudomonas VAP with
   persistence of pseudomonas+ sputum cultures, thought to be respiratory
   colonizers with fevers attributed to fungemia.
   - Continue meropenem for pseudomonas VAP X 15 days (last dose [**2111-7-6**]
   as likely the fevers are from fungemia. Consider BAL per ID recs if
   respiratory status worsens but currently improving daily.
   - Weaned off vent to trach mask. Now off propofol and valium - cont to
   decrease dose of fentanyl patch q3d.
   - Completed prednisone taper (last dose [**2111-7-4**])
   - F/u CT chest final read
   - On lasix 160mg tid but may be nearing euvolemia as BUN bumping; will
   reassess dose after I/O check in PM with goal net neg 1 L over 24h
   # AFib with RVR: CHADS2 score 1. Had been on heparin but was stopped
   about 1 week ago as was felt to be just lone Afib but has had several
   self-limited episodes of recurrence; currently in sinus.
   - Continue to monitor on tele
   - Increase ASA to full dose; could consider starting coumadin
   - Cont amiodarone low dose beta blocker for long term rate control as
   pressures allow with prn beta blocker doses for rate control
   # Concern for embolic event: L arm thought to be without movement
   yesterday and R pupil sluggish but CT head without acute intracranial
   process and now moving all extremities although LUE somewhat less than
   RUE. Of note, recent afib with CHADS 2 on heparin gtt until switched to
   ASA and hep SQ several days ago. No vegetations seen on TTE.
   - Hold further imaging for now; consider repeat CT head in 48 hours
   ([**7-6**]) if concern remains
   # Constipation: Increase bowel regimen

   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Candidemia: C. parasilopsis growing from BCx from [**7-1**] drawn from
   a-line as well. Ucx also persistently growing yeast. PICC tip cx with
   Coag neg Staph, presumed contaminant given no growth on other bcx to
   date. Suboptimal TTE without evidence of vegetation although concern
   yesterday for embolic event as above. No endophtalmitis on exam.
   - On micafungin (D1 [**2111-7-3**])
   - Cont line holiday as long as possible
   - Cont daily surveillance mycolytic and routine blood cx tmrw
   - Appreciate ID input; f/u recs including need for TEE and antifungal
   course
   - Appreciate Ophtho eval
    # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: Initially presented with H1N1 with MRSA
   superinfection and ARDS physiology; now on tx for pseudomonas VAP with
   persistence of pseudomonas+ sputum cultures, thought to be respiratory
   colonizers with fevers attributed to fungemia.
   - Continue meropenem for pseudomonas VAP X 15 days (last dose [**2111-7-6**]
   as likely the fevers are from fungemia. Consider BAL per ID recs if
   respiratory status worsens but currently improving daily.
   - Weaned off vent to trach mask. Now off propofol and valium - cont to
   decrease dose of fentanyl patch q3d.
   - Completed prednisone taper (last dose [**2111-7-4**])
   - F/u CT chest final read
   - On lasix 160mg tid but may be nearing euvolemia as BUN bumping; will
   reassess dose after I/O check in PM with goal net neg 1 L over 24h
   # AFib with RVR: CHADS2 score 1. Had been on heparin but was stopped
   about 1 week ago as was felt to be just lone Afib but has had several
   self-limited episodes of recurrence; currently in sinus.
   - Continue to monitor on tele
   - Increase ASA to full dose; could consider starting coumadin
   - Cont amiodarone low dose beta blocker for long term rate control as
   pressures allow with prn beta blocker doses for rate control
   # Concern for embolic event: L arm thought to be without movement
   yesterday and R pupil sluggish but CT head without acute intracranial
   process and observed to have spontaneous movement later in day. Of
   note, recent afib with CHADS 2 on heparin gtt until switched to ASA and
   hep SQ several days ago. No vegetations seen on TTE.

   Assessment and Plan
   66 year-old female with PMH significant for asthma, COPD, DM,
   hypothyroidism with acute on chronic dyspnea, treated with antibiotics
   for pneumonia and intubated for hypoxic respiratory failure.
   # Candidemia: C. PARAPSILOSIS growing from BCx from [**7-1**] drawn from
   a-line as well. Ucx also persistently growing yeast. PICC tip cx with
   Coag neg Staph, presumed contaminant given no growth on other bcx to
   date. Suboptimal TTE without evidence of vegetation. No endophtalmitis
   on exam.
   - On micafungin (D1 [**2111-7-3**])
   - Cont line holiday as long as possible
   - Cont daily surveillance mycolytic and routine blood cx tmrw
   - Appreciate ID input; f/u recs
   - Appreciate Ophtho eval
    # Hypoxic Respiratory failure: Initially presented with H1N1 with MRSA
   superinfection and ARDS physiology. Trach and PEG on [**2111-6-29**]; now on tx
   for pseudomonas VAP with persistence of pseudomonas+ sputum cultures,
   thought to be respiratory colonizers with fevers attributed to
   fungemia.
   - Complete meropenem course today for pseudomonas VAP X 15 days.
   Consider BAL per ID recs if respiratory status worsens but currently
   improving daily.
   - Weaned off vent to trach mask. Now off propofol and valium - cont to
   decrease dose of fentanyl patch q3d.
   - Completed prednisone taper (last dose [**2111-7-4**])
   - F/u CT chest final read
   - D/c
ed lasix as BUN bumping; will reassess after I/O check in PM with
   goal net even
   # AFib with RVR: CHADS2 score 1. Had been on heparin but was stopped
   about 1 week ago as was felt to be just lone Afib but has had several
   self-limited episodes of recurrence; currently in sinus.
   - Continue to monitor on tele
   - Increase ASA to full dose; could consider starting coumadin
   - Cont amiodarone low dose beta blocker for long term rate control as
   pressures allow with prn beta blocker doses for rate control
   # Concern for embolic event: L arm thought to be without movement and R
   pupil sluggish but CT head without acute intracranial process and now
   moving all extremities although LUE somewhat less than RUE. Of note,
   recent afib with CHADS 2 on heparin gtt until switched to ASA and hep
   SQ several days ago. No vegetations seen on TTE.
   - Hold further imaging for now; consider repeat CT head in 48 hours
   ([**7-6**]) if concern remains
   # Constipation: Increase bowel regimen

Brief Hospital Course:
80 year old female who presented to [**Hospital 8050**] hospital with
malaise and substernal chest pain which resolved with
administration of nitro, morphine, lopressor.  Based upon her
ECG, ECHO and cardiac enzymes, the most likely diagnosis was
prior distal LAD MI with recent onset myopericarditis.
.
# Chest Pain: Patient presented with chest pain, elevated
cardiac enzymes, and diffuse ST elevations on EKG. Her chest
pain resolved prior to admission; she had no recurrent symptoms.
Her cardiac catheterization, as described above, showed mild
disease but no occlusions and no intervention was necessary. She
subsequently had a cardiac MRI which showed enhanced gadolinium
uptake (near-transmural) in a coronary distribution (mid LAD),
suggestive of an ischemic etiology for her apical hypokinesis
seen on Echo; the pericardial effusion was stable. It was
thought she had a prior distal LAD territory MI with recent
myopericarditis (enhancement of pericardium and inflammation of
myocardium on cardiac MR). Of note, the final read is not in OMR
at time of discharge but was discussed between attendings. The
final report will be sent to her new cardiologist.  She was
discharged on Aspirin 81 mg daily, statin, beta-blocker, and
ace-inhibitor. She was anticoagulated for prophylaxis of apical
thrombus (and AF).

# Atrial fibrilation: The patient developed afib with RVR 3 days
after admission and spontaneously converted to SR. This was
thought to be due to local irritation secondary to
myopericarditis. She had an additional episode of RVR prior to
dishcarge with conversion to SR after three doses of 5 mg IV
lopressor.  She was asymptomatic and hemodynamically stable
during these episodies.  She was discharged on Metoprolol
Succinate XL 75 mg daily as well as Warfarin 2.5 mg daily with
close follow-up of her INR.

# Hypoxia: CXR showed pulmonary fibrosis and hypertension in the
setting of no history of lung disease. Patient was weaned from
O2 to room air.  Her hypoxia was discussed with her PCP with
plan for an outpatient work up of her disease.

# VP Shunt: Following the patient's cardiac MRI, a skull x-ray
showed the shunt tip to be stable. Neurosurgery was consulted
and the shunt was reprogrammed the day of the MRI.

# HTN: BP remained stable throughout admission and was
maintained on Metoprolol and Enalapril. Patient discharged on
Metoprolol as above and Enalapril Maleate 10 mg daily.

# Cornea transplant, Left eye: Patient maintained on home
Predforte throughout admission.

Patient remained full code throughout admission.

 There was uniform resting perfusion of all visualized segments.  There was an

 There was transmural signal enhancement seen in the apex and lateral wall,
 consistent with myocardial edema.

 cysts in the right lobe of the liver.  There are thoracic and lumbar
